questions.explanation:
Hg.

	From the Latin word hydrargyrum (liquid silver).

questions.text: At ordinary room temperatures, mercury exists in this form.
questions.explanation:
Liquid.

	Mercury is the only transition metal that is liquid at room temperature.

questions.text: From the 16th century until 2000 much of the world's mercury was produced from the Almaden mine located in which European country?
questions.explanation:
Spain.

	The chief ore is cinnabar.

questions.text: Mercury is in this classification of elements.
What are alloys of mercury and other metals called?
questions.explanation:
amalgams & amalgam.

	Amalgams were used for dental work, being easily shaped. But concerns over mercury poisoning have prompted use of ceramics and other materials.
